snippet: Despite fears that reducing the practice of stop and frisk by the New York Police Department would encourage criminals and lead to more crime, the opposite seems to be true.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes despite fears that reducing practice of stop and frisk by the New York Police Department would encourage criminals and lead to more crime, opposite seems to be true; says city in 2012 had fewest recorded homicides in 50 years.
lead_paragraph: Despite fears that reducing the practice of stop and frisk by the New York Police Department would encourage criminals and lead to more crime, the opposite seems to be true.

headline.seo: Police Stops Are Down in New York; So Is Murder
headline.main: Police Stops Are Down; So Is Murder
headline.print_headline: Police Stops Are Down; So Is Murder
